alert.note: Alert for Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued December 16 at 11:40AM PST until December 17 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MST /11 PM PST/ TONIGHT TO 9 AM MST /8 AM PST/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures in the lower 30s expected. * WHERE...In Arizona, Parker Valley, Kofa, Southeast Yuma County, Gila River Valley, Tonopah Desert, Gila Bend, West Pinal County and Sonoran Desert National Monument. In California, Palo Verde Valley. * WHEN...From midnight MST /11 PM PST/ tonight to 9 AM MST /8 AM PST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
